Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Stenting and Aggressive Medical Management for Intracranial Stenosis

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence

Participants.evidence: included patients with ICAD who experienced a hemorrhagic or ischemic stroke or a cerebral infarct with temporary signs (CITS) within 30 days post-angioplasty and stenting

Intervention.evidence: angioplasty and stenting for intracranial atherosclerotic disease (ICAD)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of peri-procedural stroke within 30 days

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment ensured

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the intervention

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 21 patients experienced an ischemic stroke (n=19) or CITS (n=2) within 30 days of angioplasty and stenting

Result_Outcome.evidence: The majority of ischemic strokes (n=15) occurred in the perforator territory

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included wire perforation leading to hemorrhage in three cases

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered under [Trial Registration Number]
